page.title: 04SETTLEMENT CHANGES cont.
page.content:
1823-24 Yet more growth in Ferring and Kingston. Durrington, though scattered, was beginning to grow too. It was interesting to note that three farms near Highdown disappeared on this map and reappeared later. It was decided that this most probably was due to an error on the map makers part.
1913 With the coming of the railway in 1845, and of a station in Goring , we expected more change. The outflow of settlements came later from Worthing though. Small growth only had taken place in each area. The woods had beeb further cut into with a proper road now through them as there is today.
